name: 010_uptree_x_get_ruby
description: travel to up_tree, exaimine, get ruby
expected_full_outputs:
*** Entrance ***

You stand upon the ancient drawbridge at the entrance of Dark Castle. The murky waters of the moat swirl beneath your feet and, before you, barring your way, is the ominous front gate.

Behind you, just beyond the drawbridge, is an extremely old and rusty postbox besides which stands a large tree with some low branches. Across the way from the postbox is a big rock covered in moss and lichen. 

There is a Front Gate to the north, a climb leading up, an Untrodden Path to the southwest, a leap down to the moat to the east, and a leap down to the moat to the west.

A large oak tree with low-hanging branches stands just beyond the rusty postbox. Its gnarled trunk and sprawling limbs give it a majestic appearance, despite the dark and gloomy surroundings of Dark Castle. The tree seems to offer a small refuge from the foreboding atmosphere of the castle entrance.

(choosing the 'up' direction in which to climb)

With a jump to the first branch you clamber up the trail-side tree.

*** Up Tree ***

You are perched in a large tree about ten feet above the ground. The nearest branch above you is above your reach. From your vantage point, Dark Castle looms as darkly as ever and the moat looks even more vile and unappealing than it does from the drawbridge. Still, the tree's wide branches are grand and calming.

Just above you - where the next branch should be - is a tree hollow. By standing on your tippy-toes on your current branch, you could just peek into it. 

There is a climb leading down.

On the ground below you can see: a Postbox. 

Dark Castle looms over you. Its facade of blackened turrets and cracked battlements is dour and singlularly univiting and the sky above it foreboding and eternally overcast in dark storm clouds. It's hard to imagine but your great grandma Nana used to tell wonderous stories of the old days when the castle gleamed brightly on its hill and was a beacon of order and goodness for the land. Maybe it's because of the stories, but you've always had a bit of an itch to venture inside. The place has somehow called to you - almost daring you to enter... And now that a round of beer and your alehouse repuation as a fearless ruffian (and perhaps even the attentions of young miss Chrissy Brewer!) are on the line, you intend to answer the call!

From your lofty perch up in the tree you can see the moat below you. From up here it's clear that the water isn't swirling randomly. You're now quite confident that there are multiple large creatures inhabting the moat - and you suspect that they re not friendly.

From your lofty perch up in the tree you can see the drawbridge below you. From up here, it looks even more rickety and worn and the bite marks are clearer - definitely crocs - and some of them made recently.

The hollow in the tree trunk is just big enough to hold a small object. It looks like it might once have held the winter nut store of an enterprising squirell but, if so, the nuts have all been consumed.

The Tree Hollow contains: a Red Ruby. 

Taken

A glittering red ruby, about the size of a walnut. This is a real treasure! For a moment you imagine the smile of delight from miss Chrissy Brewer as you triumphantly present it to her.

Done

The hollow in the tree trunk is just big enough to hold a small object. It looks like it might once have held the winter nut store of an enterprising squirell but, if so, the nuts have all been consumed.

The Tree Hollow contains: a Cheese Wedge. 

*** Up Tree ***

You are perched in a large tree about ten feet above the ground. The nearest branch above you is above your reach. From your vantage point, Dark Castle looms as darkly as ever and the moat looks even more vile and unappealing than it does from the drawbridge. Still, the tree's wide branches are grand and calming.

Just above you - where the next branch should be - is a tree hollow. By standing on your tippy-toes on your current branch, you could just peek into it. 

There is a climb leading down.

On the ground below you can see: a Postbox. 

You can't see a Postbox here.

in a feat of unaccustomed agility, you manage to land on your feet without killing yourself.

*** Entrance ***

You stand upon the ancient drawbridge at the entrance of Dark Castle. The murky waters of the moat swirl beneath your feet and, before you, barring your way, is the ominous front gate.

Behind you, just beyond the drawbridge, is an extremely old and rusty postbox besides which stands a large tree with some low branches. Across the way from the postbox is a big rock covered in moss and lichen. 

There is a Front Gate to the north, a climb leading up, an Untrodden Path to the southwest, a leap down to the moat to the east, and a leap down to the moat to the west.

You cast an apraising inner eye and take stock: Manly rough-and-tumble good looks - check, Affable demeanor paired with self-depreciating humor - check!, A lifetime of finely-honed baking skills - check!! Yep - that's you Burt - A fine specimen of a man. If not for the belching, farting, and cussing I don't know how you'd ever manage to fend off the ladies!

In your off hand you hold a Brass Lantern.

In your backpack you have: a Rusty Key, a Paper Bag, an Earthen Jug (containing a Well Water), and a Red Ruby. 

Dropped

From your vantage point, Dark Castle looms as darkly as ever and the moat looks even more vile and unappealing than it does from the drawbridge. Still, the tree's wide branches are grand and calming.

Just above you - where the next branch should be - is a tree hollow. By standing on your tippy-toes on your current branch, you could just peek into it. 

There is a climb leading down.

On the ground below you can see: an Earthen Jug (containing a Well Water) and a Postbox. 

The next branch above you is too high for you to reach. You can't climb any higher.

I don't see a Jug here.
